HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]

HDG.LP.content: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)

HDG.LP.content: the wanderers who follow strangers [now strangers themselves], now split (geschieden) from “loved ones,” to the strangers they are “others”: “the cast of the decomposed form of man (der Schlag der verwesten Gestalt des Menschen)”
HDG.LP.linkedContent: the wanderers who follow strangers [now strangers themselves], now split (geschieden) from “loved ones,” to the strangers they are “others”: “the cast of the decomposed form of man (der Schlag der verwesten Gestalt des Menschen)”

HDG.LP.content: turmoil, curse, [2nd blow], carries each kind (Geschlechter) into irreconcilable split, fragmented stamp, so cleft in 2, can’t find its proper cast (rechter Schlag) [differance not primary for Heidegger here] > the duality of proper cast leaves discord behind, leading into gentleness of simple twofoldness (einfältigen Zwiefalt) [Schelling’s indifference point? sexual difference that isn’t the discord of sexual duality], follows the stranger
HDG.LP.linkedContent: turmoil, curse, [2nd blow], carries each kind (Geschlechter) into irreconcilable split, fragmented stamp, so cleft in 2, can’t find its proper cast (rechter Schlag) [differance not primary for Heidegger here] > the duality of proper cast leaves discord behind, leading into gentleness of simple twofoldness (einfältigen Zwiefalt) [Schelling’s indifference point? sexual difference that isn’t the discord of sexual duality], follows the stranger

HDG.LP.content: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

HDG.LP.content: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

HDG.LP.content: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

HDG.LP.content: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]

HDG.LP.content: gold, truth, rightness > [death] earliness in which stranger has expired (verstorben), shelters the Wesensgerechte of the unborn > the end (Ende) not sequel (Folge) of beginning, its the end of decaying Geschlechtes, thus precedes (vorauf) beginning of unborn Geschlechtes: as earlier earliness, has already overtaken the end
HDG.LP.linkedContent: gold, truth, rightness > [death] earliness in which stranger has expired (verstorben), shelters the Wesensgerechte of the unborn > the end (Ende) not sequel (Folge) of beginning, its the end of decaying Geschlechtes, thus precedes (vorauf) beginning of unborn Geschlechtes: as earlier earliness, has already overtaken the end

HDG.LP.content: apartness not the desolation (Ödnis) of departed dead > stranger measures off (durchmisst) the parting (Abschied) from previous Geschlecht [mankind hitherto], he is underway on a path (Pfad) > departed, the stranger is set apart, one of the select (Erlesenen)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: apartness not the desolation (Ödnis) of departed dead > stranger measures off (durchmisst) the parting (Abschied) from previous Geschlecht [mankind hitherto], he is underway on a path (Pfad) > departed, the stranger is set apart, one of the select (Erlesenen)

HDG.LP.content: the friend becomes a stranger by listening to one, sings of the death, the going under, of the departed & sings of the decaying Geschlecht the stranger parted (schied)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: the friend becomes a stranger by listening to one, sings of the death, the going under, of the departed & sings of the decaying Geschlecht the stranger parted (schied)

HDG.LP.content: ghostly years of earliness: true time of stranger & friend > f
HDG.LP.linkedContent: ghostly years of earliness: true time of stranger & friend > f

HDG.LP.content: friend’s invitation (Einladung) to conversation (Gespräch) reflects (entspricht) haunting music of stranger’s steps > the Sage of the friend: singing journey by stream [path]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: friend’s invitation (Einladung) to conversation (Gespräch) reflects (entspricht) haunting music of stranger’s steps > the Sage of the friend: singing journey by stream [path]

HDG.LP.content: in singing his song, friend becomes the stranger’s brother & also brother of stranger’s sister
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in singing his song, friend becomes the stranger’s brother & also brother of stranger’s sister

HDG.LP.content: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)

HDG.LP.content: friend gazing at stranger, parts from cast (Schlag) of man that has forgotten [Being] stiller childhood & never carried unborn to full term [?]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: friend gazing at stranger, parts from cast (Schlag) of man that has forgotten [Being] stiller childhood & never carried unborn to full term [?]

HDG.LP.content: poet only becomes poet as he follows “madman” [stranger], calls to the brother who follows him [?] > friend’s face (Antlizt) looks into face of stranger: Augenblick [instant] of this glance moves the Sage of the listener
HDG.LP.linkedContent: poet only becomes poet as he follows “madman” [stranger], calls to the brother who follows him [?] > friend’s face (Antlizt) looks into face of stranger: Augenblick [instant] of this glance moves the Sage of the listener

HDG.LP.content: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes
